name: Attach any relevant documents or photos
BATCH DETAIL NUMBER OF PRODUCTS - EACH DELIVERY
Enviro Flex FC/ Sika Flex Pro
Submit samples for approval as per Specific Material Requirements.
Hold Point (Mandatory) - Subcontractor Contracts Admin inspection sign off
First of type of inspection conducted by builder prior to commencment of works taking place.
Hold Point (Mandatory) - Site engineer/ foreman first of type inspection sign off
Store materials in a dry, clean place away from direct sunlight as per TDS
Ensure a smooth substrate without protrusions, voids, or formwork distortions. The substrate should be free of honeycombing/bug holes.
Patching products must be fully cured as per PDS before applying the membrane.
Acceptance of Puddle Flanges - AS3740-2021 Section 4.3.1
All Puddle flanges to be recessed into substrate to finish flush ready for waterproofing.
FC sheeting to have max 6mm gap at floor/wall junction.
Sheets to be set with manufacturers base coat, including all nails, penetrations and corners.
Mortar in block work needs to be a flush joint, smooth and level with the blocks, no blow outs of mortar.
Builder to confirm compliant falls; minimum 1-100 falls and 1-80 in Showers
Hold Point (Mandatory) - work not to proceed without approval
Ensure no substrate cracks greater than 1.6mm.
Cracks of 1.6mm and over, movement structural joints, cold joints and Live cracks are to be referred to engineers for treatment methodology.
Site engineer/foreman pre commencement inspection review
Site engineer/ foreman inspection - sign off
Ensure Surface is prepared to receive primer application.
Clean substrate so that it is free of mould, paint, sealers, coatings, curing agents, loose particles and other contamination or foreign matter that may interfere with the adhesion.
Achieve CSP2 and CSP3 Concrete finish.
Remove all sharp edges including screws, nails and concrete/mortar projection.
Steel surfaces should be treated with appropriate degreasers, then grit blasted and/or wire brushed where necessary.
Site engineer/foreman substrate preperation inspection review
Ensure Surface is prepared to receive primer application.
Clean Substrate so that it is free of mould, paint, sealers, coatings, curing agents, loose particles and other contamination or foreign matter that may interfere with the adhesion.
Achieve CSP2 and CSP3 Concrete finish.
Remove all sharp edges including screws, nails and concrete/mortar projection.
Steel surfaces should be treated with appropriate degreasers, then grit blasted and/or wire brushed where necessary.
Moisture Content - Enviro Epoxy B-LV Product TDS
Check moisture content of substrate, not to exceed 6% (Min.1 test per 10m2).
Weather/RH - Enviro Epoxy BL-V Product TDS
Product Mixing - Enviro Epoxy BL-V Product TDS
Mix Part A (12L) and Part B (6L) seperately add Part B, liquid hardener, to the Enviro Epoxy B-LV Part A base.
Enviro Epoxy B-LV should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed with a suitable mixing paddle attached.
Mix for 3 minutes or until uniform with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less than 400 RPM) prior to application.
Application - Enviro Epoxy BL-V Product TDS
Apply primer using a brush or roller and casting aggregate for every 5 m2 applied.
Applications of excessive build should be avoided, and material must not be allowed to pool on the substrate surface
Ensure Primer is dry and tack free (within 24 hours) prior to next coat.
Apply compatible sealant to form smooth flexible cove to all internal corners, penetrations and joints.

This is to be a 12mm x 12mm coved fillet as per AS3740 class III membrane requirements for internal areas and 15mm x 15mm coved fillet as per AS4654.1 class III membrane requirements for external areas.
Bond breaker to be tack free prior to coating.
Site Engineer/foreman bond breaker inspection review
• Product should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less than 400 RPM) prior to application.
• 700X to be applied by roller vertically on substrate and terminating min 150mm with brush.
Minimum application requirements set forth relevant Australian Standards to be followed
Allow membrane to dry for 24 Hours before proceeding to the second coat.
Subcontractor first base coat inspection review
Site Engineer/foreman first base coat inspection review
• Product should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less than 400 RPM) prior to application.
• 700X to be applied by roller Horizontally on substrate and terminating min 150mm with brush.
Minimum application requirements set forth relevant Australian Standards to be followed
Allow membrane to dry for 24 Hours before proceeding to the second coat.
Subcontractor Second base coat inspection review
Site Engineer/foreman Second base coat inspection review
Inspect after installation of reinforcement/finishes to check for any damage to waterproofing and rectify as required.
Thickness testing of application to the recommended DFT of 1.0mm to manufacturers instructions.( 1 test per 10m2)
Conduct Electronic Leak Testing ( ELT) on area membraned

Ensure Vertical terminations of membrane on a building element are provided with a pressure seal, reglet or by being overcoated with a waterproof or water resistant material to protect the membrane edge.
Attach any relevant documents or photos

Ensure Vertical terminations of membrane on a building element are provided with a pressure seal, reglet or by being overcoated with a waterproof or water resistant material to protect the membrane edge.
• Enviro 250NS should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less that 400 RPM) prior to application.
• 250NS to be applied using roller and brush.
• Ensure Product is cured for 24 hours prior to second coat.
Subcontractor first top coat inspection review
Site Engineer/foreman first top coat inspection review
• Enviro 250NS should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less that 400 RPM) prior to application.
• 250NS to be applied using roller and brush.
• Ensure Product is cured for 24 hours prior to second coat.
Site Engineer/foreman second top coat inspection review
